original: HALL, Gösta Arvid, Civilingenjör, Direktör, Stockholm, f Sundsvall 15/3 99 av fond-mäkl S A H o Laura Carlson, gm Elsa Olin. Studex Sthlm 17, KTH (kemi) 17—21, studieresa t USA 25 o Frankr 30. Anst v Scandi-navian Pulp Agency Inc i Sthlm 23, utförde spec.undersökn betr cellulosa o papper v Stat Provn.anst f sv statens o sv finpappersbrukens räkning 24—25, ch.kemist v Albemarle Paper Mfg Co i Richmond Va USA 26—27, ing v Korsnäs Sågverks AB :s cellulosafabriker 28—30, övering o tekn rådgiv inom Sv Cellulosa AB:s försäljn.org 30—32, led f den sv o finska sulfatcellulosaind:s propagandalab f Europa i Paris 34—37, tekn rådgivare v Sv Cellulosa AB:s försäljningsavdelning i Sthlm sed. 37. Ordf i kommittén f standardisering av cellulosaprovningsmetoder 28^^—32. Ledamot av Sv ind.deleg t USA 44. Styr.led i Sv Ing.sällsk i Frankr 35. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Av trycket: Permance of paper (26), Några erfa-renh betr fiberkaraktärens o målningens inflytande på hållfasthetsegenskaperna h papper (28), Identification and evaluation of un-bleached chemical wood pulps (29), Quelques innovations techniques importantes dans 1’in-dustrie suédoise de cellulose (30), The Swe-dish Pulp Companys new sulphate pulp mill ät östrand (32), Tiber dje Erzeugung von schweren Kraftpapieren fiir Wellpappkisten (34), Un apergu de la fabrication du papier kraft (35) samt upps i in o utl fackpress.
translated: HALL, Gösta Arvid, Civil Engineer, Director, Stockholm, b. Sundsvall 15/3 99, son of fund broker S A H and Laura Carlson, m. Elsa Olin. Completed studies in Stockholm in 1917, KTH (chemistry) 17-21, study trips to the USA in 1925 and France in 1930. Employed at Scandinavian Pulp Agency Inc in Stockholm from 1923, conducted special investigations on cellulose and paper for the state testing institute for Swedish state and Swedish fine paper factories from 1924-1925, chief chemist at Albemarle Paper Mfg Co in Richmond, VA, USA from 1926-1927, engineer at Korsnäs Sawmills AB's pulp mills from 1928-1930, then head engineer and technical adviser in the sales organization of Sv Cellulosa AB from 1930-1932, member and leader of the Swedish and Finnish sulfate cellulose industry's propaganda laboratory in Europe in Paris from 1934-1937, technical adviser in the sales department of Sv Cellulosa AB in Stockholm since 1937. Chairman of the committee for standardization of cellulose testing methods from 1928-1932. Member of the Swedish industry delegation to the USA in 1944. Board member of the Swedish Engineering Society in France in 1935. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Published works include: Permance of paper (1926), Some observations on the influence of fiber characteristics and sizing on strength properties of paper (1928), Identification and evaluation of unbleached chemical wood pulps (1929), Some important technical innovations in the Swedish cellulose industry (1930), The Swedish Pulp Company's new sulfate pulp mill at Östrand (1932), Production of heavy kraft papers for corrugated boxes (1934), A glimpse of kraft paper production (1935), as well as articles in domestic and foreign trade press.
